text: Paulina Dudek (born 16 June 1997) is a Polish footballer who plays as a defender for French Division 1 Féminine club Paris Saint-Germain and the Poland national team. ==Career== Formed in Stilon Gorzów Wielkopolski, Dudek joined Medyk Konin prior to 2014–15 season and went on to win three consecutive Ekstraliga titles. On 7 May 2017, she scored her first hat-trick in a 5–0 win against AZS PWSZ Wałbrzych. She signed for Paris Saint-Germain in January 2018. Dudek was the captain of Poland under-17 team which won 2013 UEFA Women's Under-17 Championship. She has also been capped by Poland national team, appearing for the team during 2019 FIFA Women's World Cup qualifiers. ==Career statistics== ===International=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" ! colspan=3 | Poland |- !Year!!Apps!!Goals |- |2014||7||0 |- |2015||2||0 |- |2016||5||0 |- |2017||8||2 |- |2018||5||0 |- |2019||3||1 |- |2020||2||0 |- !Total||32||3 |} ==Honours== ===Club=== Medyk Konin *Ekstraliga: 2014–15, 2015–16, 2016–17 *Polish Cup: 2014–15, 2015–16, 2016–17 Paris Saint-Germain *Coupe de France: 2017–18 ===International=== *UEFA Women's Under-17 Championship: 2013 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:Polish women's footballers Category:Poland women's international footballers Category:Women's association football defenders Category:Medyk Konin players Category:Paris Saint-Germain Féminine players Category:Division 1 Féminine players
title: Paulina Dudek
